name: factionalism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a situation in which a group forms within a larger group, especially one with slightly different ideas from the main group: Factionalism was tearing the party and the country apart. We want to rid the movement of factionalism. See
faction
More examplesFewer examplesThe country could collapse into factionalism and civil war.Factionalism drew the group ever more deeply into petty gripes and grievances.She mourns the tolerant, cosmopolitan city of her youth and decries the factionalism that led to its ruin.
